tn.ref: This was the word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh
tn.text: "This is what Yahweh said to Jeremiah"

tn.ref: Nebuzaradan, the captain of the king's bodyguards
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:30:08|39:9]].

tn.ref: That was where Jeremiah had been taken to, and where he had been bound with chains
tn.text: AT: "That was where the Babylonian soldiers had taken Jeremiah and put him in chains" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: who were to be exiled to Babylon
tn.text: AT: "whom the soldiers were sending to Babylon"

tn.ref: Yahweh brought it about. He did just as he had decreed
tn.text: AT: "Yahweh did what he told you he would do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: since you people sinned against him and did not obey his voice
tn.text: AT: "since you Judeans sinned against Yahweh and did not obey his command" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"this disaster has happened"
Nebuzaradan says this to bring Jeremiah's attention to the present moment.

tn.ref: it is good in your eyes
tn.text: AT: "you want to"
See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:39:11|39:14]].
"among the Judeans"

tn.ref: it is good in your eyes
tn.text: "you think it is good" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: who were left behind in the land
tn.text: "who stayed in Judah"
This marks a new part of the story.

tn.ref: those who had not been exiled to Babylon
tn.text: "those whom the enemy soldiers had not sent to Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
In 40:8 these are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This refers to a person from the region of Maacah.
"swore to the Judean commanders"
This refers to seasonal crops.

tn.ref: Live in the cities that you have occupied
tn.text: "Live in your cities"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:32:10|32:12]].
AT: "all the Judeans among the people of Ammon." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"a remnant of the people of Judah"
"had put ... in charge of them"

tn.ref: Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:39:11|39:14]].
"over the people of Judah"
"where they had fled to" or AT: "where the Babylonians had driven them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: wine and summer fruit in great abundance
tn.text: "a huge amount of grapes and summer fruit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
